intro: Carex tsaratananensis, commonly known as the Tsaratanana sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or swampy areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny flowers. It plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
